short_summary: AMENDMENT TO CLOSING TIME RFP Foreign Banking Services
description: Request for Proposal for Foreign Banking Services with Confidential Information for Bidding ",
full_summary:
Requests for Proposals
EN891-240208 RFP Foreign Banking Services
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
[Date: April 12, 2024]

### Invitation to Bid

**Public Notice Reference:** WS4294792498

**Modification Number:** 2

**Solicitation Number:** WS4294792498

**Closing Date for Bids:** May 28, 2024 at 14:00 (Eastern Daylight Time)

### Proposals Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) hereby invites qualified suppliers to submit their proposals for Foreign Banking Services. This acquisition aims to obtain specialized banking services for foreign-currency disbursements, international CAD wires, the dispensation of foreign-currency banknotes, and related foreign-currency conversions.

### IMPORTANT: Bid Submission Information

All bid submissions must be received by May 28, 2024, at 14:00 (EDT). To be eligible, suppliers must sign a Confidentiality Agreement substantially in the form set out in Attachment 1 to Part 2, before accessing confidential information.

### Acquisition Scope

This procurement includes:

* Issuance of foreign-currency disbursements
* Issuance of international CAD wires
* Dispensation of foreign-currency banknotes
* Acceptance of foreign-currency receipts
* Related foreign-currency conversions

### Request for Proposal Process

The Request for Proposal (RFP) will be conducted through the Ariba Discovery portal. Interested suppliers must register and post their proposal on the platform. Suppliers must also submit their bid by the specified closing date.

### Contact Information

Inquiries and other communications regarding this purchase should be directed to:

Beauchamp, Alexandria (SPAC/PSPC)
Contact Information:

* Email: alexandria.beauchamp@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* Phone: None
* Fax: None

Note that this is a collaborative acquisition with the Receiver General for Canada. Suppliers must comply with all relevant laws and regulations, including applicable trade agreements and procurement policies.

### Disclaimer

This notice is not a commitment by the government to purchase anything.

### Additional Information

Suppliers can access additional information on the Ariba Discovery portal (https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19389166?extsite=MTkzODkxNjZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==). Suppliers are responsible for ensuring they possess the necessary
